thread.title: Gap’s solution to competition from fast fashion? Join them
thread.title_full: Gap’s solution to competition from fast fashion? Join them - San Francisco Chronicle

author: Tony Bravo
title: Gap’s solution to competition from fast fashion? Join them
text:
Photo: Michael Macor, The Chronicle At shopping centers such athe Westfield Mall in Santa Clara, retail giants like Gap must contend with boutique stores’ gains in clothing sales in recent years. At shopping centers such athe Westfield Mall in Santa Clara, retail...
The oversized window displays at Gap’s San Francisco flagship, facing the Powell Street cable car turnaround, are prime real estate, designed to bring shoppers and tourists into the store. But the company’s latest collection of relaxed denim, striped T-shirts and knits, positioned for fall shoppers, could have come from any era in the brand’s 46-year history. That’s the problem: They hardly register with those walking by. At shopping centers such athe Westfield Mall in Santa Clara, retail giants like Gap must contend with boutique stores’ gains in clothing sales in recent years. But the company’s latest collection of relaxed denim, striped T-shirts and knits, positioned for fall shoppers, could have come from any era in the brand’s 46-year history. That’s the problem: They hardly register with those walking by.
